intro: Microstachys daphnoides var. incana, commonly known as the woolly daphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. It is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and unique texture.
